intro: Psychotria calciphila, commonly known as the limestone psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the limestone-rich regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained, calcareous soils and is often found in moist, shaded habitats. Due to its specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
